author: Alex Michaelides
review: A psychological thriller that keeps you guessing until the very end. The plot is intense and the twist is brilliant.

author: Michelle Obama
review: An inspiring memoir that gives insight into the life of one of the most influential women in the world. Well-written and motivating.

author: Tara Westover
review: A gripping memoir of a woman who grew up in a survivalist family and the journey of escaping that life to find education. Truly moving and powerful.

author: Delia Owens
review: A beautifully written mystery set in the swamps of North Carolina. A story of survival, isolation, and a deep connection to nature.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A classic that captures the confusion and angst of adolescence through the eyes of Holden Caulfield. Its impact is still felt today.

author: Matt Haig
review: A thought-provoking novel about life choices, regrets, and the infinite possibilities of what our lives could have been.

author: Paula Hawkins
review: A psychological thriller with unexpected twists and complex characters. A gripping read that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

bookName: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
review: A fascinating look at the history of humans, from the Stone Age to modern times. Harari explores the evolution of societies, beliefs, and technology.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A timeless fantasy adventure that introduces readers to Middle-earth. Tolkienâ€™s world-building and storytelling are unparalleled.
